name: Todd Rokita
tweet: The Governor was correct to sign this manifestation of our God-given Second Amendment right into code and he should be recognized for that.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: We will defend any attacks on constitutional carry and remain committed not only to the right to defend ourselves and our families, but to the great women and men of law enforcement statewide.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: We stand by the law and will vigorously defend it in court if and hopefully when the General Assembly overrides the veto.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Last week I awarded my office’s first ever Public Service Award. Julia Payne, who is in the Solicitor General’s division, was nominated and won. She has gone above and beyond in her work and serves Hoosiers well. Congratulations, Julia!  https://t.co/w2LrVc5pBg

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Buying a home is a lot of Hoosiers’ dream, but some companies may try to take advantage of you during the buying process. Read more here before considering a rent-to-own agreement.  https://t.co/xb06VAYrq9

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Indiana is fortunate to have had Steve Creason serving in the Office of Attorney General for 23 years. Steve has now begun a new public service role as Magistrate in the Marion County Circuit Court and though we are sorry to lose him, we wish him all the best!  https://t.co/cHWcNGuqyF

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Good luck to Wabash College basketball in the NCAA Division III Final Four tonight in Fort Wayne! If you’re looking for tickets to the game, or other March Madness games, be on the lookout for scams. Learn more:  https://t.co/zFfErGhRWb  #WAF  https://t.co/Hyv5KPxW9G

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Keep up to date with the latest updates from my office by subscribing to the Rokita Review where liberty is always in action. Subscribe for updates here:  https://t.co/FuscpOLNg8

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: See what waits at the end of the rainbow and test your luck with a search for your unclaimed property. It’s easier than finding a four-leaf clover. Read more here:  https://t.co/jgHVEDVdDC

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: There are building materials for the border wall just sitting and rotting all on long along the border. You, the taxpayer, paid for those materials and Biden is purposely letting them go to waste. This carelessness is not helping Americans.  https://t.co/Kf97cLqAK0

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: I am now on Truth Social where the first amendment and free speech is respected and protected. Follow me on the TRUTH app @AGToddRokita!

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Border crossings are going up—February saw almost 10,000 more illegal immigrants than January. Biden’s open border means more human trafficking, drugs, and crime. We must protect our nation’s southern border and our national security.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Excited to be on the show tonight! Tune in to hear my latest update.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: My office is participating in Women’s History Month all throughout the state. They visited Viewpoint Books, the second oldest full-service bookstore in Indiana. It's located in Columbus and is woman-owned. If you’re ever in the area, you should check it out!  https://t.co/KMJl6P5mzx

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: With cybersecurity crimes up 54%, it’s imperative to understand evolving threats, manage risk and enforce a cybersecurity plan to protect public funds. My office helps with data privacy--file a complaint or access resources here:  https://t.co/Pb02lEolyv

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Jillean Battle from my office gave a presentation to county treasurers this week for National Consumer Protection Week on data security. Data security is crucial for all levels of government.  https://t.co/NXjhI8Wiq5

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: I enjoyed my tour last week of @TelamonCorp in Carmel. They have partnered with Vincennes & Purdue to give students an opportunity to participate in robotics. When forward-thinking companies invest in Indiana, all Hoosiers benefit! Check out the website:  https://t.co/0lCbX6SR1j  https://t.co/tC3R0Ro1Xb

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: National Consumer Protection Week is a good time to remember that most robocalls are scammers trying to steal your hard-earned money and personal information. Click here for important steps to protect yourself.  https://t.co/romWfuabbV

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: I loved talking with industry leaders and Hoosier truck drivers at the Work Truck Industry Trade Show at the Indiana Convention Center. What better place to hold the show than the Crossroads of America!  https://t.co/jab7fFA5id

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Parents finally have the right to be heard. As we pointed out in the Parents’ Bill of Rights, it was not mandatory that school boards hear testimony. The legislators have now corrected this, but there’s much more work to be done.  https://t.co/z8LrU5XoMV

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Protecting Hoosiers is my top priority. Data privacy is an increasingly important issue and National Consumer Protection Week is a great time to make sure you’re doing all you can to keep yourself and your family safe. Click for more info:  https://t.co/Nw3pQVThlK

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: The passage of HEA 1041 to ban males from competing on female sports teams is an important step in protecting youth sports and has been championed by my office. We welcome the opportunity to defend this law if challenged in court.  https://t.co/jNv9NzjDuG

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Of all Biden’s ridiculous COVID mandates, among the silliest has been the forced masking of children as young as 2 years old at Head Start childcare programs. I’ll keep fighting for liberty and common sense. Read the multistate letter:  https://t.co/9FMdZZs93g

tweet: It’s sad but not surprising that overdoses are on the rise with Biden’s open-border policy that makes it easy for drug runners. We are living with the consequences of his devastating policy, so I’ll keep fighting on behalf of Hoosiers:  https://t.co/CmR209MCJW

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Biden’s vaccine mandate for federal contractors was gross government overreach from the start. I’m still trying to hammer the final nails into the coffins of these attacks on personal liberties. Read the multistate amicus brief:  https://t.co/vFulSLMAy7

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: The passage of constitutional carry (HEA 1296) is a big win for common sense. This new law enshrines the constitutional rights of law-abiding citizens to bear arms.  https://t.co/taN8V2Heql

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Every life is precious! Last weekend my team had the honor of attending Indy Life Conference! What a great turnout of pro-life Hoosiers!  https://t.co/hrBoNUmBie

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: I am proud to celebrate Women’s History Month. Did you know that women comprise more than half of my 400-person staff? Thankful for the leadership of so many talented individuals who work hard for Hoosiers.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Hoosiers need to be aware of cryptocurrency scams. It’s an often-misunderstood topic, but digital assets are increasingly being used by well-versed perpetrators. Check out some of the warning signs:  https://t.co/03kvqbB5X9

tweet: Spring is almost here & homeowners across the state will begin home improvements & repair projects. Hoosiers should take precautions & do their research before hiring a home improvement contractor. Stay on the lookout for home improvement scammers.  https://t.co/u4mq0rTJJe

name: Todd Rokita

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Today a women’s suffrage historical marker was dedicated at the Statehouse. It serves as a reminder of the battle that women fought for the 19th amendment. We pay homage to the many heroic Hoosier women who were instrumental in the fight for suffrage.

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: My team is out in Hartford City today bringing my office to you for National Consumer Protection Week. Protecting Hoosier consumers is a main priority for my office.  https://t.co/eRVQ3R718L

tweet: I’m protecting and defending Hoosiers as we investigate the T-Mobile data breach. Companies must be held accountable. Hoosiers’ liberties come first. Read more about the investigation here:  https://t.co/wy0djoAsky

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: I was honored to keynote last night’s League of Miracles gala with my wife Kathy. This special organization puts kids with special needs at the heart and center of a sports complex specifically designed for them.  https://t.co/FdOHFLSQhe

name: Todd Rokita
tweet: Great news for Hoosier families! The passage of HB 1130 gives parents the right to speak at school board meetings beginning July 1. This was a top concern of parents I spoke with and that’s why I included it in my Parents’ Bill of Rights. Read more:  https://t.co/ZVvYWNAF11

name: Todd Rokita
